728377f-a.text:
2571 Arthur Kill Road, north side, at the head of Winant Avenue, showing the Golder House, seen across part of Rossville Cemetery. The maps of 1874 and 1898 show the house to have been owned by
Dr. R. H. Golder.
March 16, 1925
By Wm. T. Davis through P. L. Sperr
(2)
A front view of the Golder House, across Arthur
Kil1 Road.
April 30, 1929
P. L. Sperr

Arthur Kill Road, east side, at Winant Place, showing the Charleston Station of the United States Post Office.
September 23, 1927
P. L. Sperr

728376f-a.text:
2556 (right) and 2546 Arthur Kill Road, at, and adjoining the S.E. corner of Winant Avenue. The corner house is the iehlmeyer store.
April 30, 1929
P. L. Sperr

728376f-a.original_title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Winant Avenue

728378f-a.text:
2591 Arthur Kill Road, north side, adjoining (to the west) Winant Avenue. This house belonged to D. C. La Forge (1898) and earlier (1874) to C. Cole. Dates refer to maps on which the owners' names appear.
April 30, 1929
P. L. Sperr

728459f-b.text:
Arthur Kill Road, north side, at the head of Winant Avenue, showing the Mary Cole house. It stands about 175 yards back of the road (in rear of No. 2571) near the shore of Arthur Kill.
April 30, 1929
P. L. Sperr
(2)
Part of the Cole property, viewing toward
Arthur Kill.
April 30, 1929
P. L. Sperr
